image.altText: Satellite imagery of buildings and aid. The aid and buildings are highlighted with an orange border

props.synopsis: When the ABC's Middle-East correspondent, Matt Doran, visited an aid depot inside Gaza last week, Israel tightly controlled where he could go and what he could see. Satellite imagery reveals what's beyond the fences.

title.children: Satellite imagery shows what Israel didn't show our correspondent in Gaza

image.altText: thousands of demonstrators attend a protest in tel aviv

props.synopsis: Protesters demanded an immediate end to the Gaza campaign and call for the release of the hostages.

title.children: Thousands rally in Tel Aviv against Netanyahu’s new Gaza plan

image.altText: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy speaks during a press briefing raising his hands

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says a meeting with European and US officials to discuss the ongoing war with Russia was constructive.

title.children: Zelenskyy calls for 'lasting peace' after officials meet in UK

image.altText: A woman holds a baby while smiling and standing by the river

props.synopsis: They talk of sleepless nights, a "love like no other", maybe even the odd meltdown. But not of the silent fury you might feel towards the demands of motherhood. Experts say maternal anger isn't just a normal response to impossible expectations: It's a vital sign about what mothers need — and aren't getting.

title.children: How mothers are 'gaslit' into suppressing their 'completely normal' anger

image.altText: Young girl standing outside, smiling, wearing pink Dora The Explorer bucket hat.

props.synopsis: A campaign to educate people about the dangers of coercive control and cults begins in southern Queensland following the death of an eight-year-old girl.

title.children: Child's death drives churches to call out cult-like behaviour

image.altText: The sun rises over the Southern Ocean

props.synopsis: Lead the research and lead the way on Antarctica but as the US cuts environmental funding questions are raised about the future of science there.

title.children: Why China may soon be seen as the new authority on Antarctica

image.altText: A graphic showing a woman and a young girl and DNA strands.

props.synopsis: Shandee Blackburn was murdered in 2013. Twelve years later, the fallout of botched forensic work has led to a reckoning for Queensland's forensic lab.

title.children: 'Critical errors' in a forensic lab threw thousands of cases into question

image.altText: A man smokes next to the Reserve Bank of Australia headquarters.

props.synopsis: Quarterly data raises hopes among overstretched mortgage holders that a rate cut is coming.

title.children: Inflation figures point to a rate cut. But how long until borrowers see savings?

image.altText: A lady sitting and smiling off camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Labor will appoint independent upper house MP Ruth Forrest as treasurer — if the party is able to form minority government when parliament resumes.

title.children: Labor names respected MLC as would-be treasurer in bid for government

image.altText: Andrew Hastie speaks at a lectern.

props.synopsis: With state Liberal parties at loggerheads with the federal leader on their commitment to net zero, some robust debate is inevitable — but keeping it from spilling over is a persistent challenge.

title.children: Is the Liberal take on net zero sparking healthy debate, or damaging division?

image.altText: A black and white photograph of a man standing by a tree

props.synopsis: From taunting police, escaping prison and commanding political pressure for an early release, charm and intelligence was the secret to Queensland's "elite" bushranger.

title.children: The Wild Scotchman was Queensland's charming, intellectual bushranger

image.altText: A woman wearing a denim jacket and a colourful bandana stands outdoors smiling.

props.synopsis: After being diagnosed with breast cancer Canberran Jenna Macdonald-Golden was left in a grim financial position, forced to put her mortgage on hold amid a series of unexpected cancer-related expenses.

title.children: Unexpected cancer costs left Jenna unable to afford groceries and petrol

image.altText: A graphic showing a man looking at censored images on a phone with the Telegraph and MaskPark logos.

props.synopsis: Women in China urge Beijing to act after exploitative videos and photos, many taken in secret, are shared on Telegram channels.

title.children: Hidden cameras capture explicit videos of women in China

image.altText: West Coast Eagles players standing following a match, as a presentation goes on

props.synopsis: The AFL's worst-performing team should consider spending beyond the club's salary soft-cap  — and pay the associated tax — to fast track its rebuild, according to former Fremantle captain Peter Bell.

title.children: West Coast should consider spending beyond club salary cap, says Dockers great

image.altText: A large truck on its side. It is on fire.

props.synopsis: Large plumes of thick, black smoke are visible in western Victoria after an accident involving two B-Double trucks on the Western Highway.

title.children: Section of Western Highway closed after accident involving two trucks

image.altText: Emily Wurramara with short blonde hair wearing big hoop earings, gold top and holding a fan of feathers

props.synopsis: The 2025 winners of the National Indigenous Music Awards have been announced, highlighting internationally acclaimed and emerging First Nations talent.

title.children: Emily Wurramara wins Artist of the Year at National Indigenous Music Awards

image.altText: Frightened men and women seen crouching under heavy black metallic shields in front of a cloud of white smoke

props.synopsis: A newly filmed TV series in Taiwan, titled Zero Day Attack, presents a close representation of the reality Taiwanese citizens have been living with in the face of simmering threats from China, for years.

title.children: Actors say Taiwan drama confronts uncomfortable truths of China threat

image.altText: A man wearing a large hat and blue work shirt leans against a fence

props.synopsis: As Larry Acton looks to retirement, he is grappling with whether to sell his land at a loss or hand the property, which has contaminated groundwater, to his son.

title.children: Cattle farmer faces tough choice after property contaminated by PFAS

image.altText: A Parliament House in the early morning sun.

props.synopsis: A no-confidence motion, an election and now another no-confidence motion. It's all been happening in Tasmanian politics, now what happens next?

title.children: Tasmania reappointed it premier last week but a new bid to replace the government is imminent

image.altText: A middleaged woman with a white shirt and blue cap with the words 'Inherited', photographed in parkland.

props.synopsis: Robyn Smith will be running bare-chested at the City2Surf. She will be among 90,000 people taking part in the annual event from the Sydney CBD to Bondi Beach.

title.children: Robyn Smith to run bare chested in Sydney's City2Surf after double mastectomy

image.altText: Show image for Hard Quiz: Tom Gleeson in a navy blue suit in a studio.

props.synopsis: It's all well and good to be a know-it-all on the couch, but it's time to walk all that talk of yours.

title.children: Think you could be a Hard Quiz contestant? I've heard that before

image.altText: Two middle-aged men in dark coats stand behind lecterns at an outdoor press conference.

props.synopsis: Christopher Luxon embraces Anthony Albanese ahead of their seventh meeting as prime ministers, after Mr Albanese was welcomed to the country with a traditional Māori pōwhiri ceremony.

title.children: Uncertainty in the Pacific and Middle East dominates PM's talks in NZ

image.altText: Maya Joint plays a forehand at the Canadian Open.

props.synopsis: As her breakout season continues, rising Australian tennis star Maya Joint fights her way into the third round of the Cincinnati Open.

title.children: Joint leads Aussie charge at Cincinnati Open

image.altText: A woman in a wet suit holds up a sign and flippers

props.synopsis: Tara Rawson recently set a new Australian record of more than 80m while competing in an international free diving competition in Asia.

title.children: WA free diver pushes boundaries to set new Australian record

image.altText: Three children sitting on a mat, playing with colourful lego.

props.synopsis: For many Australian parents the 9am to 3pm school day doesn't line up with their working day, but in large parts of the country accessing a spot at before and after-school care is not an option.

title.children: These are Australia's best and worst regions to access out-of-school care

image.altText: Two men pose next to a woman in a white, sunlit room

props.synopsis: Stranger Things star Dacre Montgomery froze for his art to appear alongside Phantom Thread's Vicky Krieps in spooky drama Went Up the Hill.

title.children: This New Zealand drama's filming locations were so cold the cameras froze

image.altText: Luke Littler smiles during a darts competition in England.

props.synopsis: World champion Luke Littler demonstrates his phenomenal teenage talent in Wollongong by winning the star-studded Australian Darts Masters.

title.children: Teenage world champ Littler triumphs at Australian Darts Masters

image.altText: Elderly man in car with seatbelt on smiling.

props.synopsis: Some may baulk at the thought of driving in their 90s, but for this senior, having a licence is a ticket to freedom.

title.children: Having a driver's licence gives older Aussies purpose and independence

image.altText: A man in a khaki shirt with a camera on his neck holds up an orange lizard in both hands towards camera.

props.synopsis: There is growing momentum in Australia's conservation planning to incorporate First Nations knowledge into the management of culturally significant species such as the great desert skink.

title.children: This lizard faces extinction, but an Indigenous-led plan could save it

image.altText: The underside of two wind turbine blades in helix form attached to the top of a pole with wires

props.synopsis: A small-scale wind turbine has been developed in Adelaide in the hope of supplying energy direct to off-grid users, including farms, wineries and construction sites.

title.children: Wind turbine trial sparks hope as small-scale power source

image.altText: An Adelaide Crows AFLW player attempts to mark in front of a Collingwood opponent.

props.synopsis: AFLW arrived like a freight train in 2017, changing Australian rules football forever. Photographs have told its story and challenged the status quo.

title.children: AFLW is celebrating 10 seasons, these photographs tell its story

image.altText: A small bright green airplane in a hanger.

props.synopsis: It's been a week since Tasmanian couple Gregory Vaughan and Kim Worner along with their dog Molly, stepped into a small green plane and flew away without a trace.

title.children: How can a plane go missing in 2025? Tasmanian couple's disappearance sparks questions

image.altText: two images, one on the left is a new social media map feature and the other is a man riding a bike

props.synopsis: Instagram users are voicing concern their whereabouts were shared without their knowledge despite Meta saying the feature is opt-in.

title.children: Instagram's new location feature has left users feeling 'sick'

image.altText: A grey-haired woman in her home.

props.synopsis: Australia's first migrant resource centre started the country's largest anti-discrimination case in the 1980s. Forty-five years on, the women involved reflect on the fight.

title.children: Migrant women reflect on landmark equality case

image.altText: Matt Wright pic (1)

props.synopsis: Bugged phone calls, allegations of lies and planned destruction of evidence — revelations from the first week of the criminal trial against Outback Wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: Outback Wrangler's bugged midnight phone call at centre of charge
